title: Enable smart contract notifications for Direct Data Onboarding (DDO)
description: Removes the restriction limiting sector content change notifications to the storage market actor, allowing any actor (e.g., smart contracts) to receive FRC-42 notifications for DDO events, enabling new use cases and integrations.

storageProviders: Storage providers can now specify any actor (not just the market actor) to receive notifications about sector data onboarding, enabling integration with custom marketplaces, DAOs, and DeFi applications.
Providers retain control via the require_notification_success flag, allowing them to determine whether notification failures abort sector commitments.
Notification grouping by notifee reduces gas costs and allows providers to optimize notification delivery.
clients: Clients can benefit from enhanced data availability and verification schemes implemented by smart contracts that receive direct notifications.
Enables real-time tracking and more dynamic storage services, potentially improving reliability and transparency for client applications.
tokenHolders: Expands the utility and programmability of Filecoin, potentially increasing network activity and FIL usage for new DeFi and data-centric applications.
No direct impact on FIL supply or economics, but indirect benefits through ecosystem growth and innovation.
applicationDevelopers: Smart contract developers can now implement logic that responds directly to sector data onboarding events, supporting custom deal activation, verification, and other advanced use cases.
Developers must implement secure notification handling, including caller verification and CBOR parameter decoding, and consider gas usage and failure handling.
Filecoin tooling (e.g., filecoin-solidity) will need updates to support new notification types and data structures.
